item.title: Dealing with files in Go
item.description: File existence Useful when you want to have consistency checking file existence, with a bit more granularity. func exists(file string) (bool, error) { _, err := os.Stat(file) // stat success, file exists, exit early if err == nil { return true, nil } // check for an os.ErrNotExist, "file does not exist". Return false and no errors. if os.IsNotExist(err) { return false, nil } // error from stat return false, err } Used as follows:
